bibl.title: Letter from George Parker to Henry Rose Carter, March 18, 1922

div1.p: Parker sends Carter a paper on malaria work in Texas.

div1.head: Letter from George Parker to Henry Rose Carter, March 18, 1922
div1.p:
I am enclosing a complimentary
copy of a report which I have just finished, and
believe it may be of interest to you. One interesting
feature is that it has been demonstrated, beyond any
doubt, in my mind, that malaria was controlled in the
unit towns.

An intensive county-wide campaign
was planned to result from this survey but I was taken
out of Texas, and the activities recorded in the report
were not carried as far as I had planned.
With all good wishes, I am,
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, George Parker. Dr. H. R. Carter,
2121 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
